data.meta_site_name: MiS Magazine | Daily exploration of Creativity & Innovation
data.text:
CanadianÂ brothersÂ DVBBSÂ keep showcasing their creative prowess by breaking genre barriers with their new single withÂ Wiz KhalifaÂ – “SH SH SHÂ (Hit That),” a record sitting on the intersection of bass and hip hop music, infused with a sample coming from a startup rapper, urfavxboyfriend, thatÂ DVBBSÂ accidentally stumbled upon on hisÂ TikTokÂ account on one of the uploads. They loved the line from the get-go and knew they had to make it into a full-length track.Â WizÂ wasted no time jumping on board, and the rest is history – a unique sound that seesÂ DVBBSÂ experimenting andÂ Wiz‘s signature flow with the catchy “SH SH SH” vocal overlay. This unusual release is part of the growing trend ofÂ TikTokÂ mashups that have become popular with the platform andÂ Instagram‘s videos, giving previously unknown artists yet another way to break through to the masses. Viral dancer and social media personalityÂ Casey FreyÂ recently uploaded his video take on “SH SH SHÂ (Hit That)” withÂ DVBBSÂ &Â Wiz Khalifa‘s track toÂ Instagram, which has amassed overÂ 280KÂ likes and surpassedÂ 6M viewsÂ within onlyÂ 3 daysÂ from its upload.

DVBBS

Only a few producers have risen to the top in the electronic music scene as quickly asÂ DVBBS, who captured the industry’s attention with hits like “Tsunami” and “Not Going Home” and never let it go. TheÂ CanadianÂ brothersÂ AlexÂ andÂ ChristopherÂ have been continuously cultivating their sound since their debut in 2012 and have racked up an impressive display of collaborations with renowned names from diverse musical backgrounds, such asÂ blackbear,Â 24kGoldn,Â Jasmine Thompson,Â Belly,Â NERVO,Â Juicy J,Â Galantis,Â Cody Simpson,Â Aloe Blacc,Â Icona Pop,Â GASHI,Â and more.Â DVBBSÂ continue to prove there’s nothing they can’t accomplish. Their hits, such as “La La Land,” “Gold Skies,” and the breakthrough “Angel” are staples in every dance music fan’s library. Prior to the global pandemic,Â DVBBSÂ performed a staggering 250 dates per year at some of the world’s hottest music festivals and top-tier clubs, includingÂ Tomorrowland,Â EDC Las Vegas,Â Ultra Music Festival,Â Hakkasan Las VegasÂ orÂ Ibiza’s Amnesia, andÂ Ushuaia. Throughout their career,Â DVBBSÂ has proved they are relentlessly dedicated to expanding their global footprint and bringing cutting-edge new music to their listeners.

Wiz Khalifa
